#Text=The Oklahoma City Thunder ( 31 - 25 ) defeated the Denver Nuggets ( 20 - 35 ) 119 - 94 on Sunday at Chesapeake Energy Arena in Oklahoma City .
#Text=The Thunder came out on fire in this game , out - scoring the Nuggets 36 - 18 in the first quarter alone , while eventually finishing the first half with a 67 - 42 lead .

#Text=Adding to the strong start , the Thunder shot very well in this game , going 52 percent from the field and 40 percent from the three - point line , while the Nuggets finished at 36 percent from the field and a meager 26 percent from deep .
#Text=To go along with their superior shooting , the Thunder also had a strong showing on the glass , securing a 60 - 42 rebounding advantage .
#Text=The Thunder had three players reach the 20 - point plateau .

#Text=As he 's been doing all season long , the Russell Westbrook show continued , as he went 8 - for - 12 from the field and 2 - for - 3 from the three - point line to finish with a team - high of 21 points , while adding eight rebounds and 17 assists in just 27 minutes .
#Text=He was extremely effective , and could 've had some even bigger numbers , if he was n't pulled due to a huge lead .

#Text=Coming out of the All-Star break , he 's picked up right where he left off , recording three double - doubles in a row , a stretch where he 's averaged 29 points , 7 rebounds and 12 assists per game .
#Text=Newly aquired center Enes Kanter played very well in his second game as a member of the Thunder .
#Text=He posted 20 points ( 8 - 12 FG , 4 - 6 FT ) and 12 rebounds , notching his second double - double in as many games with the Thunder .
#Text=He 's combined for 30 points and 25 rebounds during that span .
#Text=Nearing a triple - double of his own , Serge Ibaka finished with 20 points ( 10 - 18 FG , 0 - 1 3Pt ) , eight rebounds and eight blocked shots in just 26 minutes .
#Text=Just like Westbrook , he was extremely effective in a limited amount of minutes .
#Text=Dion Waiters chipped in with 17 points ( 7 - 15 FG , 1 - 2 3Pt , 2 - 2 FT ) off the bench .
#Text=The Nuggets struggled to get their offense going , with only three players reaching double figures in points .

#Text=After sitting out of Friday 's game against the Bucks for an undisclosed reason , Ty Lawson moved back into the starting lineup and led the team with 17 points ( 6 - 12 FG , 0 - 2 3PT , 5 - 5 FT ) , four assists and three steals in just 23 minutes .
#Text=This was his first game since February tenth , so it was good to see there was n't much rust despite the lengthy absence .
#Text=Starting at shooting guard , Danilo Gallinari also did as much as he could to keep the Nuggets alive .
#Text=He went 5 - for - 11 from the field and 3 - for - 6 from the three - point line to post 16 points in 19 minutes .
#Text=He shot a brutal 25 percent ( 3 - 12 FG ) from the field in Friday 's game against the Bucks , so it was good to seem him have better success with his shot this time around .
#Text=The only other player in double figures was rookie center Jusuf Nurkic .
#Text=He recorded 10 points ( 5 - 13 FG ) and seven rebounds , but could n't do it defensively and was n't able to slow down the Thunder 's bigs .
#Text=The Thunder 's next game will be at home against the Indiana Pacers on Tuesday , while the Nuggets will be at home against the Brooklyn Nets on Monday .
